artciles.q:
Terzaghi's one-dimensional consolidation
            theory assumes that
option: e vs. p relationship is linear
e vs. log p relationship is linear
p vs. log e relationship is linear
e vs log p/p0 relationship is linear
artciles.answer: e vs. log p relationship is linear

artciles.q: The coefficient of consolidation is used for
option: establishing the duration of primary consolidation
estimating the amount of settlement for a load increment
determining the depth to which the soil is stressed when loads are applied on the surface of a soil deposit
determining the preconsolidation pressure for soil deposits known to be over consolidated
artciles.answer: establishing the duration of primary consolidation
artciles.description:
For a given degree of consolidation U, time factor T has a certain value, depending upon the boundary conditions governing the problem. 
            The time required for a soil to reach a given degree of consolidation can be calculated by knowing the length of drainage path and coefficient of consolidation.

artciles.q: The slope of the e-log curve for a soil mass gives

artciles.description: The slow rate of consolidation of saturated clays of low permeability may be accelerated by means of vertical sand drains which provide for radial drainage, resulting in shortening of drainage path. Consolidation is then mainly due to horizontal radial drainage which results in a faster dissipation of excess pore water pressure.

artciles.q:
The time for a clay layer to achieve 90%
            consolidation is 15 years. The time required
            to achieve 90% consolidation, if the layer
            were twice as thick, 3 times more permeable
            and 4 times more compressible would be
artciles.description:
As the clay layer is 3 times more permeable
            and 4 times more compressible, therefore
            time required for 90% consolidation

option: is a function of the effective stress
does not depend on the present stress
is a function of the pore water pressure
is a function of the total stress
artciles.answer: is a function of the pore water pressure

artciles.q:
Identify the two False statements from the
            following four statements
            I. The consolidation of soil happens due to
            the change in total stress.
            II. When Standard Penetration Tests are
            performed in fine sands below the water
            table, the dilation correction is applied
            after the overburden correction is applied.
            III. Over consolidated clays will have
            predominantly cohesive, strength as
            compared to the frictional strength
            IV. Compaction of soils is due to expulsion

The time for a clay layer to achieve 85%
            consolidation is 10 years. If the layer was
            half as thick, 10 times more permeable and
            4 times more compressible then the time that
            would be required to achieve the same
            degree of consolidation is

A double draining clay layer, 6 m thick,
            settles by 30 mm in three years under the
            influence of certain loads. Its final
            consolidation settlement has been estimated
            to be 120 mm. If a thin layer of sand having
            negligible thickness is introduced at a depth
            of 1.5 m below the top surface, the final
            consolidation settlement of clay layer will be
artciles.description:
Final settelment will not be altered.
            However the rate of settlement of clay layer will increase

artciles.q:
If the elastic modulus and the Poisson's ratio
            of the clay layer are respectively
            50 x 10^3 kPa and 0.4 and if the influence
            factor for the strip footing is 1.75, the elastic
            settlement of the footing will be

A 6 m thick clay layer undergoes 90%
            consolidation four times faster under two-  
            way drainage as compared to one-way
            drainage. In an identical clay layer of 15 m
            thickness, two-way drainage will be faster
            as compared to one-way drainage by
artciles.description:
The time required for any degree of
            consolidation, can be obtained from the Taylor's formula

A layer of normally consolidated, saturated
            silty clay of 1 m thickness is subjected to
            one dimensional consolidation under a
            pressure increment of 20 kPa. The properties
            of the soil are: specific gravity 2.7, natural
            moisture content 45%, compression index
            = 0.45, and recompression index 0.05.
            The initial average effective stress within the
            layer is 100 kPa. Assuming Terzaghi's
            theory to be applicable, the primary
            consolidation settlement (rounded off to the
            nearest mm) is
